title: Junior Data Scientist
description: This my first professional software engineering experience. My supervisors were Maged Shalaby and Sherif AbdEl Karim. There I mainly worked on developing visualization dashboards, clustering algorithms, and building server-side applications in Django

title: Queen's University
company: Bachelor in Mathematics and Computer Engineering
description: After 17 eventful years in Egypt, I was offered two scholarships to study at Queen's University in Canada. I am currently in in my final year of Mathematics and Computer Engineering expected to graduate May 2022.

title: Lead Software Developer
description: I worked on developing a instructional video platform using React and Django.

title: Covid 19 World Project
date: May 2020, My first major side project
description: This is probably my biggest open source contribution so far. I built a worldwide Covid-19 statistics tracker along with a set of simulations that show the impact of safety measures against disease spread.

title: Software Engineer
description: I worked as part of the Watson Studio Team led by Lin Ju and Dejan Glozic. It was an amazing experience and I grew a lot as a developer. I worked on multiple microservices as part of the Watson Studio architecture. My work involved mainly full-stack development. I also filed my first patent under IBM!

title: Co-Founder and CTO at Yasa
description: Early 2020 I Co-Founded a company called Yasa. The goal was to democratize personalized fitness for online users. We used computer vision to provide real time corrections for users performing exercises using on demand videos. We raised 20k last summer, and I led a team of three engineers to develop our correction algorithm and platform. Unfortunately, we had to sunset the project due to numerous reasons. There will be more in the future for sure :)

title: First Patent
description: When I was interning at IBM in 2020 I filed my first patent for finding a novel process to perform internationalization assessments on web applications using NLP. It never crossed my mind that I would be able to do something like that so early in my career, let alone on my first professional internship.
